-2-
II. You are my wife, therefore, out of the natural affection I have for you, for the comfort of your future life, and for the love itself, without any reward, the vacant land as per the Schedule ॥॥ below has come to me as an inheritance and has been in my possession from that date till today, and I hereby declare that there is no encumbrance or any other encumbrance on the vacant land The vacant land as per Schedule I, with all the rights and obligations of the same, shall be transferred to you free of charge and without compensation by virtue of this settlement deed. Therefore, the property as per Schedule I shall be registered in your name in the records of the Panchayat etc., and all taxes shall be paid by you, and you shall construct buildings, etc. in the manner you like, and you shall carry out all the operations of use, etc., and you shall enjoy the property in perpetual comfort with all the rights of donation, sale, and right of succession. Neither I nor my heirs nor you nor your heirs shall ever have any objections, objections or disputes over this property. Therefore, no mortgages, decrees, court orders or other legal proceedings shall be entertained against this property till date. This settlement deed is written and given with my full consent, as it is an undisputed property free from any bindings such as seizures, inheritance rights, manovarti charges, kriyapuroni etc. If any such bindings are ever violated by anyone, I will be responsible for all of them and at my own expense and will be able to keep this document intact. This is my full consent to be written and given in your name.
Pedagada Achari

-3-
Srikakulam District, Palakonda Sub-Registrar's Office, Burja Mandal, Tuddal Panchayat, Tuddal Village Revenue, Taluka Survey No. 40, measuring 12 feet (3.65 m) east-west, 62 feet (18.89 m) north-south, i.e. 82.6 square yards (69.38 sq m) in area, without any constructions or foundations The vacant land without any trees or fish ponds is bounded by:
North:- CC Road
South;- Ampili Appalanaidu's vacant land
East;- Nilurothu Srihari's vacant land
West;- Simhadri Thirunatha's terrace house
The vacant land in the middle is hereby acquired by you today through a settlement deed. The Government has not written any document to you regarding this settlement property. There are no stone mines, quarries, fish ponds, fruit trees or granites here. These properties are not assigned properties. They are not agency properties.
Declaration;-
We have examined the EC details of the property.
New U/s 22-B (central Act 16 of 1908) Vide Andhra Pradesh Ordinance No. 7 of2016
dated 03-12-2016 I hereby declare that the property transferred under this deed i.e. the property inherited by me is not owned by anyone else except me and that I have not sold, traded or otherwise dealt with the property by me. I shall be fully responsible for any discrepancies in the above.
Pedagada Achari

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 238 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Pedagada Achari in favour of His Wife, Pedagada Kumari, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 82.6 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 40, situated in Tuddali Village and Panchayath, Burja Mandal, within the District of Srikakulam, registered at sub-registrar office Palakonda (108) is bounded as follows: North by: C.C. Road South by: Vacant Site Of Ampili Appalanaidu East by: Vacant Site Of Nilurothu Srihari West by: Slabbed House Of Simhadri Tirunadha.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible. 2. It is noted that the extent of 82.6 Sq. Yds. is shown in the Schedule of Property; however, in the Rule 3 statement, it is shown as 82.66 Sq. Yds. The F.I. has to verify the same.
